chapter-15_key2: A reference moment that many date and time programs use. The moment is January 1st, 1970, UTC.
chapter-15_key5: It returns the closest `integer` to the argument passed. For example, round(2.4) returns 2.
chapter-15_key6: A datetime object represents a specific moment in time. A timedelta object represents a duration of time.
chapter-15_key9: Make sure that `code` running in one thread does not read or write the same `variables` as `code` running in another thread.
